data.title: Water temperature in Magadan in the Sea of Okhotsk now
data.meta_description: What is the current water temperature in Magadan in the Sea of Okhotsk? How the water temperature will change in Magadan in the coming days. Statistics for recent years.
data.text:
Russia > Magadan Region

Magadan

Sea water temperature in Magadan today

Magadan, Russia | © iOleg

The most detailed information about the water temperature in Magadan in the Sea of Okhotsk (Magadan Region, Russia). Forecast of changes in water temperature for the next 10 days. Statistics by months for recent years. Information about the neighboring resorts. Weather forecast in Magadan for a week.

Water temperature in Magadan right now

data updated 39 minutes ago

12.7°C

yesterday: 12°C

a week ago: 12.8°C

Trend: slow drop

Today water temperature in Magadan is 12.9°C. In general, this water temperature is unacceptable for swimming. But hardened people can afford to be in such water for 5-10 minutes. In any case, the general weather is also important. So, the air temperature at the same time will reach 12°C.

Analysis and forecast

The water temperature today is slightly lower than the average on this day in recent years. Its value has rise over the last week, but has drop compared to 20 days ago. Exactly a year ago, on this day, the water temperature in this location was 14°C. Water temperature range in Magadan in August is from 10 to 18 degrees.

According to our forecast, in the coming days, the water temperature value in Magadan will slightly drop and in 10 days it will be 11.7°C.

* Fact - Actual value of water temperature

** Average - Average water temperature on this day in past years

*** Forecast - Our forecast for the water temperature

Actual nearshore temperatures may vary by several degrees from the indicated values. This is noticeable after heavy rain or after prolonged periods of strong winds. Some downstream winds cause cold, deep waters to replace surface waters that have been warmed by the sun.

To develop a forecast, we use our own mathematical model, which takes into account the current change in water temperature, historical data and the main weather trends, wind strength and direction, air temperature in each specific region. We also take into account data for other resorts in Russia.

Sandy Ground, Sint Maarten | © Ganna val

Annual graph of average water temperature change in Magadan

Water temperature in Magadan by month

Magadan located in the northern hemisphere, at latitude 59 degrees. The water in this location never warms up to comfortable values. Average annual water temperature on the coast in Magadan is 3.7°C, by the seasons: in winter -1.4°C, in spring -0.6°C, in summer 11.7°C, in autumn 4.8°C. Minimum water temperature (-2.0°C) in Magadan it happens in January, maximum (17.0°C) in July.

You can find out detailed data on how the water temperature in Magadan changes in each specific month:

The warmest water today in Russia recorded in Khosta, its value is 27.4°C. Lowest - in Mys Kamennyy, there water temperature now 2.1°C. Average water temperature in the country today - 19.6°C.

Water temperature data in Magadan and neighboring towns and resorts collected from various sources, using buoys, using satellite maps of sea, river and lake surfaces of the NOAA agency.

We use data from various local authorities in each specific location of the world to more accurately reflect temperature values.

The nearest airport is located in a 38 kilometers. This is Sokol (GDX) airport. We have no information as to whether it is valid and what flights it receives or sends.

Find out the temperature of sea water in more than 12000 cities and resorts around the world. Water surface temperature values are available in real time. There is a forecast of water temperature changes for the next few days, as well as historical data of sea surface temperature are available for all days of the last years.

We use data from various sources, including National Centers for Environmental Information (NOAA), meteorological services of different countries, data received from more than a thousand buoys around the world, satellite systems for scanning the surface of the oceans and seas.
